article.title: Observational calibration of the projection factor of Cepheids - III. The long-period Galactic Cepheid RS Puppis

multiple_choice_question.text: What type of visibility model is represented by the solid line in both panels of Figure 1?
What photometric system is used to measure the light curves of RS Pup presented in Figure 2?
choices: Two Micron All Sky Survey (2MASS) system

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the positive E² coefficient in equation (1), describing the parabolic fit to the O-C residuals, indicate about the pulsation period of RS Pup?
choices: The period is decreasing with time.
The period is constant over time.
The period is increasing with time.
The period changes erratically with no clear trend.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the approximate linear rate of change of the period of RS Pup over the past 50 years, as shown in Figure 4?
What does the parameter 'p' in the top left panel of Figure 5 represent?
What is the approximate limiting contrast in the H-band for detecting a stellar companion to RS Pup within 40 mas, as shown in Figure 6?
What quantity is represented on the vertical axis of Figure 7?
What type of distance measurements were used for the orange data points in Figure 8, representing the LMC eclipsing Cepheids?
What photometric band is used for the AAVSO light curve of RS Pup presented in Figure A.1?
What is the determined projection factor (p-factor) of RS Pup, considering the complete radial velocity dataset, as listed in Table 3?
Which reference in Table 5 predicts a constant p-factor value for both RS Pup and l Car?
